thread.title: Playlist: Charlie Puth's Marvin Gaye favorites
thread.title_full: Playlist: Charlie Puth's Marvin Gaye favorites

title: Playlist: Charlie Puth's Marvin Gaye favorites
text:
LONDON, ENGLAND - SEPTEMBER 20: Charlie Puth performs during the 2015 Apple Music Festival at The Roundhouse on September 20, 2015 in London, England. (Photo by Brian Rasic/WireImage) ORG XMIT: 579551027 ORIG FILE ID: 489367206 (Photo: Brian Rasic, WireImage)
6 CONNECT 19 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE "Let's Marvin Gaye and get it on," Charlie Puth sings in Marvin Gaye , his new duet with Meghan Trainor. But Puth's reverence for the late R&B great extends far beyond using Gaye's name as a sexy come-on. Here, Puth shares some Gaye favorites with USA TODAY.
Stubborn Kind of Fellow : The background vocalists do call and response and outline the chords. The voices are the main instruments.
How Sweet It Is (To Be Loved By You) : Believe it or not, the tambourine adds a lot to this. The song wouldn't be the same without it. I'm a producer nerd.
Ain't Nothing Like the Real Thing : I love how this song starts off with the chorus. It hits you with the hook right at the beginning. Super catchy.
You're All I Need to Get By : Love the chords in this song.
What's Going On : His vocal performance still gives me chills when I hear this song.
Mercy Mercy Me (The Ecology) : This record starts like it's going in one direction then modulates into E major, changing the vibe completely.
Your Precious Love : I love how Marvin and Tammi's voices blend together.
Let's Get It On : It's obvious. Songs about sex = win.
Sexual Healing : He pioneered using an 808 as a drum loop that started a trend for so many future records.
My Love Is Waiting : This is the last song on Marvin Gaye's last album before he passed away. It's a special closing to a beautiful career.
Listen to Puth's playlist here:
